bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 9 (Wednesday, January 16, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BEYER:H.R. 590.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, section 8, clause 4Article 1, section 8, clause 3Article 1, section 8, clause 1Article 1, section 8, clause 18First AmendmentFifth Amendment[[Page H677]][Page H676]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

Freedom of Religion Act of 2019

This bill establishes that an alien may not be denied entry, reentry, or admission to the United States, or any other immigration benefit, because of the alien's religion or lack of religious beliefs.

This bill shall not affect the authority of various government agencies or immigration officers to determine whether a particular individual may pose a threat to national security.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Freedom of Religion Act of 2019

item.title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that an alien may not be denied admission or entry to the United States, or other immigration benefits, because of the aliens religion, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
